answers.answer: its due to the increase in hormones, like estrogen.

right its the increase in hormones. if it bothers you try eating a few crackers and some tea(decaff). it always seemed to help me in the morning but i did get it at night too. when i cooked dinner i would sit down to eat and thought about what it looked like before i cooked it and got sick. i lost weight the first three months.

Im 9 weeks and I feel nauseas in the morning but Ive found that a glass of milk with the carnation milk chocolate is good and doesnt make me sick.  When I eat breakfast I get really sick feeling but never throw up.  So Ive just started drinking the carnation stuff....it has alot of nutrition and protein in it.  My OB/GYN told me about it.

Hi! I quickly googled it for you and here's the first I saw: http://www.morningsicknesshelp.com/morningsicknesscauses.htmlHormones... what can you do about it... I had almost no morningsickness the first trimester, but now at 23 weeks... it's way worse. And the only thing that works for me is eating ;-) If I don't get gestational diabetes this time (and put on a diet) I'll end up gaining more weight than with my twins ;-)

Hi everyone. I wonder if anyone has some advice for my situation? I am around 5 wks pregnant, and have had sore breasts since ovulation, cramping for the last 2 weeks, and queasiness on & off for 2 weeks. My doctor says all of these symptoms are normal in pregnancy & nothing to worry about, unless I see bleeding, which I have not. However, I am noticing the queasiness is lessening, and my breasts are not as tender as they were. The cramping seems to be a little less too. Does this mean something bad? Is it normal for symptoms to come & go this early on? I thought as the HcG levels increase in the 1st trimester, your symptoms increase too. Why are my symptoms waning now? I am worried. Any advice would be appreciated, thanks!

question: What are the scientific reasons why women get moring sickness during their first trimester. Or could you point me to a good site where i could get more in depth answers. Thank you.
title: morning sickness
